bibl.title: Letter from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, July 1940

div1.p: [Mabel Lazear] writes that she will be unable to attend the dedication ceremony at Washington and Jefferson College.

div1.head: Letter from [Mabel H. Lazear] to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, July 1940
div1.opener:
July 1940
Ralph Cooper Hutchison, Ph.D., D.D.
President
Washington and Jefferson College
Washington, Pennsylvania
Dear Dr. Hutchison:
div1.p:
The dedication of your new Chemistry Building
to my late husband, Dr. Jesse Lazear, is most touching
and I find myself unable to express fully my appreciation of
this great and lasting tribute to his memory and his work.

It would naturally be my wish to attend the
ceremonies but, unfortunately, so far as I can see at this
distance of time and miles, I can only say, with the greatest
regret, that my family and I will not be able to be there.
We shall be with you in spirit, however, and may I add that
I should treasure having a copy of the lecture of Dr. Hench,
if it is not asking too much, at that time.

Assuring you of my deep feeling of appreciation
and with our thanks for your courteous invitation, I am
